meanings.definition: To fill with an excessive number of people.
meanings.sent1: The small town became overpeopled during the summer festival.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were overpeopled with tourists during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The classroom felt overpeopled with all the students trying to fit in.
meanings.sent4: The train station was overpeopled with commuters rushing to catch their trains.
meanings.sent5: The park was overpeopled with families enjoying the sunny weather.

meanings.definition: Having too many inhabitants for the available resources.
meanings.sent1: The overpeopled island struggled to provide enough food for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The overpeopled apartment complex faced frequent water shortages.
meanings.sent3: The overpeopled campground ran out of firewood for the campers.
meanings.sent4: The overpeopled city experienced traffic jams daily due to the crowded streets.
meanings.sent5: The overpeopled village lacked enough schools for all the children.
